I must either type the full recipient address or manually select a contact; unlike other email clients, it does not suggest addresses from previous correspondence.

The following steps light be helpful: "Settings" → "Composition" → "Addressing" section → "When addressing messages, look for matching entries in:" → Tick "Local Address Books" to enable autocomplete. → Tick "Automatically add outgoing email addresses to my: ___". to make Thunderbird provide suggestion from previous correspondence.

Please see the attached image.

2. The following link might be helpful: Addressing an Email https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/addressing-email

Please see "Adding recipients from your address book" section in the above link. Quotation from the above section: "Type search words in the address field of your choice, and recipient autocomplete will assist you."

content: I believe the issue is that every email address must be saved in your personal address book. Otherwise, you have to type or copy-and-paste addresses each time, which is awkward and frustrating. The Windows version automatically remembers addresses you’ve used before and suggests them for autofill, but the Android app doesn’t. To fix this, the same autofill feature needs to be added to Android.
